history.proof: intros x y u. unfold scal, plus. rewrite ModuleSpace.ax4. reflexivity.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
K: Ring
V: ModuleSpace K

Goal:
forall (x y : K) (u : V), scal (plus x y) u = plus (scal x u) (scal y u)

Premises:
scal = ModuleSpace.scal K (AbelianGroup.Pack V (ModuleSpace.class K V) V) (ModuleSpace.class K V) : K -> V -> V
plus = fun G : AbelianGroup => AbelianGroup.plus G (AbelianGroup.class G) : forall G : AbelianGroup, G -> G -> G Argument G is implicit and maximally inserted
Notation ModuleSpace := ModuleSpace.type
ModuleSpace.Mixin : forall (K : Ring) (V : AbelianGroup) (scal : K -> V -> V), (forall (x y : K) (u : V), scal x (scal y u) = scal (mult x y) u) -> (forall u : V, scal one u = u) -> (forall (x : K) (u v : V), scal x (plus u v) = plus (scal x u) (scal x v)) -> (forall (x y : K) (u : V), scal (plus x y) u = plus (scal x u) (scal y u)) -> ModuleSpace.mixin_of K V
Record mixin_of (K : Ring) (V : AbelianGroup) : Type := Mixin { scal : K -> V -> V; ax1 : forall (x y : K) (u : V), scal x (scal y u) = scal (mult x y) u; ax2 : forall u : V, scal one u = u; ax3 : forall (x : K) (u v : V), scal x (plus u v) = plus (scal x u) (scal x v); ax4 : forall (x y : K) (u : V), scal (plus x y) u = plus (scal x u) (scal y u) } For Mixin: Argument scopes are [_ _ function_scope function_scope function_scope function_scope function_scope]
scal_assoc : forall (x y : K) (u : V), scal x (scal y u) = scal (mult x y) u
scal_distr_l : forall (x : K) (u v : V), scal x (plus u v) = plus (scal x u) (scal x v)
ModuleSpace.ax4 : forall (K : Ring) (V : AbelianGroup) (m : ModuleSpace.mixin_of K V) (x y : K) (u : V), ModuleSpace.scal K V m (plus x y) u = plus (ModuleSpace.scal K V m x u) (ModuleSpace.scal K V m y u)
ModuleSpace.ax1 : forall (K : Ring) (V : AbelianGroup) (m : ModuleSpace.mixin_of K V) (x y : K) (u : V), ModuleSpace.scal K V m x (ModuleSpace.scal K V m y u) = ModuleSpace.scal K V m (mult x y) u
ModuleSpace.ax3 : forall (K : Ring) (V : AbelianGroup) (m : ModuleSpace.mixin_of K V) (x : K) (u v : V), ModuleSpace.scal K V m x (plus u v) = plus (ModuleSpace.scal K V m x u) (ModuleSpace.scal K V m x v)
plus_assoc : forall x y z : ?G, plus x (plus y z) = plus (plus x y) z where ?G : [K : Ring V : ModuleSpace K |- AbelianGroup]
Ring.ax5 : forall (K : AbelianGroup) (m : Ring.mixin_of K) (x y z : K), Ring.mult K m x (plus y z) = plus (Ring.mult K m x y) (Ring.mult K m x z)
mult_distr_l : forall x y z : ?K, mult x (plus y z) = plus (mult x y) (mult x z) where ?K : [K : Ring V : ModuleSpace K |- Ring]
opp_plus : forall x y : ?G, opp (plus x y) = plus (opp x) (opp y) where ?G : [K : Ring V : ModuleSpace K |- AbelianGroup]
mult_distr_r : forall x y z : ?K, mult (plus x y) z = plus (mult x z) (mult y z) where ?K : [K : Ring V : ModuleSpace K |- Ring]
Ring.ax4 : forall (K : AbelianGroup) (m : Ring.mixin_of K) (x y z : K), Ring.mult K m (plus x y) z = plus (Ring.mult K m x z) (Ring.mult K m y z)
plus_comm : forall x y : ?G, plus x y = plus y x where ?G : [K : Ring V : ModuleSpace K |- AbelianGroup]
Ring.Mixin : forall (K : AbelianGroup) (mult : K -> K -> K) (one : K), (forall x y z : K, mult x (mult y z) = mult (mult x y) z) -> (forall x : K, mult x one = x) -> (forall x : K, mult one x = x) -> (forall x y z : K, mult (plus x y) z = plus (mult x z) (mult y z)) -> (forall x y z : K, mult x (plus y z) = plus (mult x y) (mult x z)) -> Ring.mixin_of K
plus_reg_l : forall r x y : ?G, plus r x = plus r y -> x = y where ?G : [K : Ring V : ModuleSpace K |- AbelianGroup]
plus_reg_r : forall r x y : ?G, plus x r = plus y r -> x = y where ?G : [K : Ring V : ModuleSpace K |- AbelianGroup]
minus_trans : forall r x y : ?G, minus x y = plus (minus x r) (minus r y) where ?G : [K : Ring V : ModuleSpace K |- AbelianGroup]
abs_triangle : forall x y : ?K, abs (plus x y) <= abs x + abs y where ?K : [K : Ring V : ModuleSpace K |- AbsRing]
AbsRing.ax3 : forall (K : Ring) (m : AbsRing.mixin_of K) (x y : K), AbsRing.abs K m (plus x y) <= AbsRing.abs K m x + AbsRing.abs K m y
Record mixin_of (G : Type) : Type := Mixin { plus : G -> G -> G; opp : G -> G; zero : G; ax1 : forall x y : G, plus x y = plus y x; ax2 : forall x y z : G, plus x (plus y z) = plus (plus x y) z; ax3 : forall x : G, plus x zero = x; ax4 : forall x : G, plus x (opp x) = zero } For mixin_of: Argument scope is [type_scope] For Mixin: Argument scopes are [type_scope function_scope function_scope _ function_scope function_scope function_scope function_scope]
Record mixin_of (K : AbelianGroup) : Type := Mixin { mult : K -> K -> K; one : AbelianGroup.sort K; ax1 : forall x y z : K, mult x (mult y z) = mult (mult x y) z; ax2 : forall x : K, mult x one = x; ax3 : forall x : K, mult one x = x; ax4 : forall x y z : K, mult (plus x y) z = plus (mult x z) (mult y z); ax5 : forall x y z : K, mult x (plus y z) = plus (mult x y) (mult x z) } For Mixin: Argument scopes are [_ function_scope _ function_scope function_scope function_scope function_scope function_scope]
Rabs_mult : forall x y : R, Rabs (x * y) = Rabs x * Rabs y
opp_mult_l : forall x y : ?K, opp (mult x y) = mult (opp x) y where ?K : [K : Ring V : ModuleSpace K |- Ring]
opp_mult_r : forall x y : ?K, opp (mult x y) = mult x (opp y) where ?K : [K : Ring V : ModuleSpace K |- Ring]
mult_assoc : forall x y z : ?K, mult x (mult y z) = mult (mult x y) z where ?K : [K : Ring V : ModuleSpace K |- Ring]
Ring.ax1 : forall (K : AbelianGroup) (m : Ring.mixin_of K) (x y z : K), Ring.mult K m x (Ring.mult K m y z) = Ring.mult K m (Ring.mult K m x y) z
AbsRing.ax4 : forall (K : Ring) (m : AbsRing.mixin_of K) (x y : K), AbsRing.abs K m (mult x y) <= AbsRing.abs K m x * AbsRing.abs K m y
scal_one : forall u : V, scal one u = u
ModuleSpace.ax2 : forall (K : Ring) (V : AbelianGroup) (m : ModuleSpace.mixin_of K V) (u : V), ModuleSpace.scal K V m one u = u
Pos.min_l : forall x y : positive, (x <= y)%positive -> Pos.min x y = x
sum_n_plus : forall (u v : nat -> ?G) (n : nat), sum_n (fun k : nat => plus (u k) (v k)) n = plus (sum_n u n) (sum_n v n) where ?G : [K : Ring V : ModuleSpace K |- AbelianGroup]
AbsRing.Mixin : forall (K : Ring) (abs : K -> R), abs zero = 0 -> abs (opp one) = 1 -> (forall x y : K, abs (plus x y) <= abs x + abs y) -> (forall x y : K, abs (mult x y) <= abs x * abs y) -> (forall x : K, abs x = 0 -> x = zero) -> AbsRing.mixin_of K
minus = fun (G : AbelianGroup) (x y : G) => plus x (opp y) : forall G : AbelianGroup, G -> G -> G Argument G is implicit and maximally inserted
sum_n_m_plus : forall (u v : nat -> ?G) (n m : nat), sum_n_m (fun k : nat => plus (u k) (v k)) n m = plus (sum_n_m u n m) (sum_n_m v n m) where ?G : [K : Ring V : ModuleSpace K |- AbelianGroup]
AbelianGroup.ax1 : forall (G : Type) (m : AbelianGroup.mixin_of G) (x y : G), AbelianGroup.plus G m x y = AbelianGroup.plus G m y x
AbelianGroup.ax2 : forall (G : Type) (m : AbelianGroup.mixin_of G) (x y z : G), AbelianGroup.plus G m x (AbelianGroup.plus G m y z) = AbelianGroup.plus G m (AbelianGroup.plus G m x y) z
Rbar_le_antisym : forall x y : Rbar, Rbar_le x y -> Rbar_le y x -> x = y
Record mixin_of (K : Ring) : Type := Mixin { abs : K -> R; ax1 : abs zero = 0; ax2 : abs (opp one) = 1; ax3 : forall x y : K, abs (plus x y) <= abs x + abs y; ax4 : forall x y : K, abs (mult x y) <= abs x * abs y; ax5 : forall x : K, abs x = 0 -> x = zero } For Mixin: Argument scopes are [_ function_scope _ _ function_scope function_scope function_scope]
plus_zero_l : forall x : ?G, plus zero x = x where ?G : [K : Ring V : ModuleSpace K |- AbelianGroup]

```coq
intros x y u.
unfold scal, plus.
rewrite ModuleSpace.ax4.
reflexivity.
Qed.
```

original: intros x y u. unfold scal, plus. rewrite ModuleSpace.ax4. reflexivity.
